questions.question: How does a callable bond differ from a non-callable bond?

options.option: Callable bonds have a fixed interest rate, while non-callable bonds have a variable rate
Callable bonds cannot be redeemed by the issuer, while non-callable bonds can be redeemed at any time
Issuers have the option to redeem callable bonds before maturity, while non-callable bonds cannot be redeemed early
Callable bonds have a higher face value than non-callable bonds

questions.question: What is the relationship between bond prices and the prevailing interest rates in the market?

options.option: Inverse relationship - as interest rates rise, bond prices generally fall
Direct relationship - as interest rates rise, bond prices also rise
No correlation - changes in interest rates do not impact bond prices
Bond prices and interest rates move independently of each other

questions.question: What is the term for a bond that is sold at a price below its face value?

options.option: Premium bond
Zero-coupon bond
Par bond
Discount bond

questions.question: How does the yield to maturity (YTM) differ from the coupon rate of a bond?

options.option: YTM is the total return on a bond, while the coupon rate is the interest paid annually
YTM is fixed, while the coupon rate may change over time
YTM is the current market price of the bond, while the coupon rate is the face value
YTM represents the total return if the bond is held until maturity, while the coupon rate is the fixed annual interest payment.
